questions.text: Let's do a quick and simple test of your understanding of this study.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of this study?
textChoices: Understand the fluctuations of Parkinson disease symptoms

questions.prompt: My name will be stored with my study data.
I can choose to share my coded study data sparsely or more broadly.
I will be able to skip any survey question.
I will be able to stop participating at any time.

quiz.failureMessage: Unfortunately you answered one or more questions incorrectly. You can return to the beginning of the walkthrough to get more information about the study.
quiz.successMessage:
You answered all of the questions correctly. 
Tap Next to continue.

sections.sectionSummary: This simple walkthrough will explain the research study, the impact it may have on your life and will allow you to provide your consent to participate.
At the end of this walkthrough, we will ask you a few questions about the details of the study.
To better understand your evolving health, we will ask you to perform simple activities and respond to surveys.
This study will also gather sensor data from your iPhone and personal devices with your permission.
Your study data (survey, activities and sensors) will be combined with similar data from other participants.
We will replace your name with a random code. The coded data will be encrypted and stored on a secure Cloud server under the control of Sage Bionetworks to prevent improper access.
Your coded data will be used for research and may be shared with other researchers worldwide.
This study will take about 20 minutes per day.
We will also ask you to answer brief weekly and monthly surveys about your symptoms to track any changes.
We will ask you to perform specific activities, like walking a few steps while holding or using your iPhone.
Your participation is voluntary. You may withdraw your consent and discontinue participation at any time.
You will be able to visualize your data and potentially learn more about trends in your health.
This research is not a treatment study.  Some questions may make you feel uncomfortable. Simply do not respond.
Participating in this study could generate a wide range of emotions.
We will make every effort to protect your information, but total anonymity cannot be guaranteed.
